meanings.definition: To treat someone as an object rather than as a person.
meanings.sent1: She objectifies her employees by only caring about their productivity.
meanings.sent2: The artist objectifies emotions in his paintings.
meanings.sent3: He objectifies his cat by dressing it up in tiny hats.
meanings.sent4: The movie objectifies the struggles of the working class.
meanings.sent5: The sculpture objectifies the beauty of nature in a unique way.

meanings.definition: To make something into an object.
meanings.sent1: The magician objectifies a coin into a flower.
meanings.sent2: The technology objectifies complex ideas into simple visuals.
meanings.sent3: The chef objectifies the ingredients into a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: Her words objectify the intangible concept of love.
meanings.sent5: The designer objectifies creativity into stunning fashion pieces.

meanings.definition: To view or portray someone as a mere physical object.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement objectifies women by focusing only on their appearance.
meanings.sent2: The novel objectifies the protagonist as a symbol of strength.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly objectifies his friend by calling him 'Mr. Muscles'.
meanings.sent4: The media often objectifies celebrities, reducing them to mere images.
meanings.sent5: The painting objectifies the model, capturing her essence in brushstrokes.
